title: Amazon's Invincible Episodes 1-3 Review & Reactions
description:
The boys give their reactions to the first 3 episodes It's About Time, Here Goes Nothing, and Who you Calling Ugly? of the Robert Kirkman created Amazon Original series Invincible.

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunny?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunny

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Nick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_Scarpino
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller, Tim Gettys, and Nick Scarpino talk about the biggest stories in nerd culture.

Music by Tonedeff - http://www.QN5.com

transcript_chunks.text: [Music] welcome back to another kind of funny reaction this time too the amazon original series invincible as always i'm tim gettys and i am joined by greg miller andy cortez nick scarpino and kevin coelho andy cortez i want to start with you as somebody who has not the only one of us that has not read invincible what did you think of the first three episodes i absolutely loved it absolutely hell yeah yeah i it it took me a while i think the first moment that kind of really got me was a little tiny line of dialogue when he's fighting uh the two robbers and the rock looking dude in the streets and he says who are yous uh i uh haven't really thought of anything yet any suggestions like that little line really really got me and anything before that i felt like a lot of the dialogue just wasn't really hitting for me like some of the moments that i should have been laughing at i just wasn't and that moment got me and then from then on i feel like everything started moving a little bit

wasn't really hitting for me like some of the moments that i should have been laughing at i just wasn't and that moment got me and then from then on i feel like everything started moving a little bit faster which you know obviously not every show is going to start off with a bang but um we have to develop his powers first um it immediately just sort of set up everything in a very um simple way to understand but it was still i love that they're still talking about you know these these large grand concepts that we haven't fully um i guess you know seen yet uh did episode one end with a bang for you did you see that coming surprise okay no yeah um now i had seen a gif of the eye popping didn't you know what i was alluding to didn't know who that was or anything like that yeah but the way episode one ended i i wish i had a camera on me because i found myself with my mouth just doing the are you [ __ ] kidding me right now moment and then it ends and then you just go holy i have to start

it was perfectly fine i think it's what the show needed um i yeah i had no issues with that whatsoever and you mentioned the runtime i think the i think that's also one of those things where i look at the animation quality and go well the show is 43 minutes like yeah it's a lot 13 13 to 18 extra minutes of animation as opposed to like usually a half hour run or whatever and when we say half hour it's more like 22 minutes or whatever um that's a lot more time to animate and that's a lot more money goes to that um but yeah i totally agree i think that the i think introducing this brand new squad worked perfectly fine because we get enough of what we need right like i don't need crazy backstory they talk about who they are they immediately show what their personalities are and you're immediately in and it's like okay what's gonna happen with this new group and then we see omni man looking at the new group going pathetic you know like what's what's this setting up for the future it's just

just the two characters next to each other and then their mouth just kind of moving as you talk like almost red versus blue style but it's like it we don't need crazy [ __ ] happening all the time because again the it's service of the story and they're they're really doing a good job with that the one thing that i have a criticism with the episode so far is i do think that the animated medium is holding them back in a way that it doesn't feel like the boys where it doesn't feel like they're always committing to the tone and an example of that for me is when mark's like doesn't have his powers yet and he's trying to learn to fly and he's outside the house and then like i forget who was the mailman or whatever like is walking by and they're talking and he's like oh sorry and then he kind of stands there and then he like falls back and it's like a weird cartoony joke thing and there's multiple moments throughout the three episodes like that that i just feel like they wouldn't have in a
